botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Patio roses are small bushy shrubs with clusters of single to double, slightly fragrant flowers about 3cm across, over a long period in summer and autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun with humus rich, moist but well drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring and a balanced fertiliser again in early summer. See rose cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or chip budding in summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, rose leafhopper, glasshouse red spidermite, scale insects, caterpillars, large rose sawfly and rose leaf rolling sawfly. Deer and rabbits may cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to rose powdery mildew, rose blackspot and rose rust
